title: Understanding the Problem
text: You are given three different groups of paint colors: shades of green, blue, and yellow. Each color has a different number of shades to choose from. You're asked how many ways you can pick a color, with the option to choose from any of these three groups.

title: Addition Principle
text: Since you're picking one color from one of these groups, and these groups don't overlap (you can't pick a color from both green and blue at the same time), you should use the Addition Principle to count the total number of ways.

title: Finding the answer
text: Add the quantity of every shade.
